revised_title: The Evolution and Distribution of Coal Fields in England: Geological Insights and Physical Changes
tldr: This paper examines the distribution of coal fields in England, focusing on the physical changes that have occurred during the Carboniferous period. The author discusses the role of geological disturbances and denudation in shaping the current coal field boundaries and suggests that the tendency of coal fields to form 'basins' is due to the intersection of two systems of flexures.
